arm_group.arm_group_label: Neck pain patients following physiotherapy treatment
arm_group.description: Neck pain patients will follow physiotherapy treatment in primary health care.

brief_summary.textblock:
The primary purpose of this study is to investigate if there is altered motor control of
      head and neck in chronic neck pain patients compared with healthy persons. In addition,
      associations between neck pain, motor control, disability and function, and clinical
      symptoms will be studied in patients following physiotherapy treatment in primary health
      care.

clinical_study.brief_title: Neck Motion and Motor Control in Chronic Neck Pain and Associations With Clinical Symptoms

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Idiopathic neck pain with duration >2 weeks

          -  Normal or corrected vision

          -  Pain at or above 3 on Numeric Rating Scale, with "low pain" defined as 3-4 and "high
             pain" as 5 or higher.

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Systemic or diagnosed chronic disease, including diabetes, stroke and neurological
             diseases, that may influence motor control and neck pain or ability to perform tests

          -  positive spurling test for neurological radiating arm pain

          -  pregnancy

          -  whiplash

          -  insufficient comprehension of Norwegian language

study_pop.textblock: Neck pain patients referred to physiotherapy treatment in primary health care

facility.name: Norwegian University of Science and Technology

clinical_study.official_title: Neck Motion and Motor Control in Chronic Neck Pain and Associations With Clinical Symptoms

other_outcome.description: Neck Disability Index and patient specific functional scale(Tampa Scale of Kinesiophobia, Pain Catastrophizing Scale and Pain Self Efficacy Scale)

overall_official.affiliation: Norwegian University of Science and Technology

oversight_info.authority: Norway:National Committee for Medical and Health Research Ethics

primary_outcome.description: Describes the movement stiffness in active movements of the neck. Conjunct motion is movement in the two associated movement planes to the primary plane. For example,the amount of rotation and lateral flexion during neck flexion and extension. Measured by 3D Liberty device and with degrees as unit of measure.

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description: Measured by a 3D Liberty device and with velocity(degrees/s)as unit of measure
Measured by 3D Liberty device and with degrees as unit of measure
Measured by 3D Liberty device and trunk sway as a unit of measure
Measured by 3D Liberty device and with velocity (degrees/second) as unit of measure
a numerical pain rating scale will be used to measure neck pain.
Head motion accuracy will be measured by a 3D Liberty device and centimeter will be used as a unit of measure
